pullRequest.title: [BEAM-10764] Make is_in_ipython robust
pullRequest.bodyText:
To handle potentially corrupted IPython dep used by the user running a
environment that is not managed by setuptools, added an any-exception
statement to treat the current code execution as not in IPython kernel
on non-import errors.

Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

beforeCommit.message:
[BEAM-10764] Make is_in_ipython robust

To handle potentially corrupted IPython dep used by the user running a
environment that is not managed by setuptools, added an any-exception
statement to treat the current code execution as not in IPython kernel
on non-import errors.

nodes.bodyText: Optional: This is a case where an explicit return False (here and for the ImportError) might make things more clear.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -34,6 +38,11 @@ def is_in_ipython():
       is_in_ipython = True
   except ImportError:
     pass  # If dependencies are not available, then not interactive for sure.
+  except (KeyboardInterrupt, SystemExit):
+    raise
+  except:  # pylint: disable=bare-except
+    _LOGGER.info(
+        'Unexpected error occurred, treated as not in IPython.', exc_info=True)

commit.message: Made explicit return statement in each return point
